answers.author: Alexandra Iannolo
answers.text:
Hello,
I found some sample Employee Education Incentive programs that may be helpful.
This is a brief over view of the plan used in the City of Hoover, AL.
http://www.ipma-hr.org/sites/default/files/educationincentive.pdf
The County of Mono, Calif. has a program in place. You can read a small description of it below but you may also want to contact the community for more specific information.
http://www.monocounty.ca.gov/departments/job_listings/Benefits.html
The Eastern Municipal Water District has an Education Incentive Program that comes with a scholarship.
http://www.emwd.org/modules/showdocument.aspx?documentid=1164
I also found the Education Incentive Program policy for non-teaching employees of The University of Texas of the Permian Basin. Their form may be a helpful reference for your own program. 
http://www.utpb.edu/media/pdf/humanresources/educationincentiveprogram.pdf
Ali Iannolo
Knowledge Network Intern
aiannolo@ICMA.org

author: Eddy Parham
text:
I am reviewing educational incentive programs that other municipalities have in place. Specifically, I would like to know if you offer any monetary incentive for employees who have earned a degree; does the degree have to be in the field that they are currently assigned i.e., a police officer with a criminal justice degree vs a police officer with a recreation management degree; what is the incentive, i.e. lump sum, percentage of current salary; do you offer higher incentives for higher degrees; and is the program available to all employees or only certain departments.
For those that do have a policy in place, I would like to get a copy if possible, which can be done off line.
title: Educational Incentive
